title: Modified Rankin Score-9Q (mRS-9Q)
description: 9-question yes/no survey that provides simple and reliable determination of the modified Rankin Scale score in neurosurgical and neurological patients

parameters.name: symptoms_bothering
parameters.description: Do you have any symptoms that are bothering you?

parameters.name: same_work
parameters.description: Are you able to do the same work as before?

parameters.name: keep_hobbies
parameters.description: Are you able to keep up with your hobbies?

parameters.name: maintain_social_ties
parameters.description: Have you maintained your ties to friends and family?

parameters.name: need_help_basic_tasks
parameters.description: Do you need help making a simple meal, doing household chores, or balancing a checkbook?

parameters.name: need_help_shopping_travel
parameters.description: Do you need help with shopping or traveling close to home?

parameters.name: need_help_walking
parameters.description: Do you need another person to help you walk?

parameters.name: need_help_personal_care
parameters.description: Do you need help with eating, going to the toilet, or bathing?

parameters.name: bedridden_nursing_care
parameters.description: Do you stay in bed most of the day and need constant nursing care?

result.name: mrs_9q_score
result.description: Modified Rankin Score 9Q result for neurological function assessment

ranges.interpretation: Perfect health without symptoms. Complete functional independence.

ranges.description: Symptoms present but able to carry out all usual duties
ranges.interpretation: No significant disability despite symptoms. Able to carry out all usual duties and activities.

ranges.description: Unable to carry out all previous activities but independent
ranges.interpretation: Slight disability. Unable to carry out all previous activities but able to look after own affairs without assistance.

ranges.description: Requires some help but able to walk unassisted
ranges.interpretation: Moderate disability. Requires some assistance but able to walk unassisted.

ranges.description: Unable to attend to bodily needs without assistance
ranges.interpretation: Moderately severe disability. Unable to attend to own bodily needs without assistance and unable to walk unassisted.

ranges.description: Bedridden and requiring constant nursing care
ranges.interpretation: Severe disability. Bedridden, incontinent and requiring constant nursing care and attention.

references: Bruno A, Shah N, Lin C, Close B, Hess DC, Davis K, Baute V, Switzer JA, Waller JL, Nichols FT. Improving modified Rankin Scale assessment with a simplified questionnaire. Stroke. 2010 May;41(5):1048-50. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.109.571562.

Bruno A, Close B, Hancock GM, Hess DC, Kahles T, Yeatts SD, Lees KR, Molina CA. Standardized modified rankin scale assessment by telephone: reliability in the ALIAS pilot trial. Stroke. 2012 Aug;43(8):2086-90. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.112.657130.

Bruno A, Akinwuntan AE, Lin C, Close B, Davis K, Baute V, Aryal R, Brooks D, Hess DC, Switzer JA, Waller JL. Simplified modified rankin scale questionnaire: reproducibility over the telephone and validation with quality of life. Stroke. 2011 Aug;42(8):2276-9. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.111.613273.
formula: Algorithm-based scoring using 9 yes/no questions to determine mRS level: Q1 determines mRS 0 vs â‰¥1, then sequential questions determine final mRS score from 0-5.
notes: Structured 9-question interview that reliably determines mRS score
Can be administered by telephone or in-person with equal reliability
Can be administered by medical or non-medical personnel
Reduces subjectivity compared to traditional mRS assessment
Web-based calculator available with automated error checking
Validated across multiple neurological and neurosurgical conditions
Excellent inter-rater reliability and test-retest reproducibility
Useful for clinical trials, quality improvement, and outcome tracking
Provides standardized approach to mRS determination
Does not include mRS 6 (death) as this is determined by patient status
Algorithm prioritizes higher disability levels when multiple criteria met
